If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.33-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72702 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+piyoc@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome, iPhone 13 / iOS 18.7.1, iPhone 13 / Safari, Samsung Galaxy A52 / Android 14 **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Preconditions: 1. Login use Expensifail account and navigate to a DM 2. Click "+" in the compose message -> click "create expense" Steps: 1. Enter any amount -> click "next" 2. Click "description" 3. Enter multiple line in the description -> click save 4. Click the search icon on the top right 5. Observe the recent search list preview ## Expected Result: IOU Report description should be displayed in search preview. ## Actual Result: IOU Report description missing in search preview unless refresh the page. It only displayed after user refresh the page (Web and mWeb) or kill the app and relaunch the app (Mobile) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3205aa41-aeaf-4ed8-a779-a77ffb98564a https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/538fab2d-87c2-4f2a-948a-5a68dea24418 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Reports - Message on preview of expense held offline on "Chats" changes when online again.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.33-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1353/folder/13176872/41237334/958156673 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1930@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Chats" 5. Turn off internet connection. 6. Open the just created expense. 7. Tap on "More" and hold the expense. 8. Return to "Chats" 9. Note that a "Expense was put on hold" message can be seen in red, on expense preview. 10. Reopen expense and turn on internet connection. 11. Return to "Chats" 12. Note that message on preview, changed to "Review required" ## Expected Result: When an expense is held while offline, a "Review required" message should be seen on preview, and it should remain the same when returning to online mode. ## Actual Result: When an expense is held while offline on "Chats" section on "Reports", a "Expense was put on hold" message can be seen in red on preview, and after recovering internet connection, message changes to "Review Required". ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b18c2cc-ba8f-4ef4-91df-ea2bea594bbc [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
